sources.description:
It's Friday@PizzaFLIX 
Produced by: Florenz Ziegfeld
Starring: Bebe Daniels, John Boles, Bert Wheeler and Robert Woolsey
Directed by: Luther Reed
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmHgXUJMN1TXEBMtSqYpWfok-xg95KXao
üçïFILM DEBUT OF WHEELER & WOOSLEYüçï
Experience a landmark in early Hollywood history with this Radio Pictures adaptation of Florenz Ziegfeld‚Äôs Broadway triumph. Produced in 1929 by RKO Productions, this groundbreaking musical "talkie" was directed by Luther Reed and features a star-studded cast including Bebe Daniels, John Boles, and the film debut of comedy duo Bert Wheeler and Robert Woolsey.

This milestone of the early sound era combines romance, intrigue, and song along the Texas-Mexico border‚Äîbringing Ziegfeld‚Äôs signature theatrical flair to the screen. Originally filmed in early two-color Technicolor, sadly, only the final reel survives in its original color format, making it a rare and partially lost cinematic treasure that reflects both the innovation and limitations of 1920s film technology.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

Initially released in early two-color Technicolor, only the final reel survives in color today‚Äîoffering a rare glimpse into the visual style of late 1920s cinema. Also featuring Don Alvarado and Geoffrey Kerr, this film remains a significant artifact from the transitional period between silent movies and synchronized sound.
